ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: The Software Engineering - Hardware Management team is looking for an Engineering Project Manager passionate about building relationships and large-scale logistics. The Hardware Allocations EPM role works cross-functionally across many teams at Apple to allocate development hardware and identify and resolve issues in support of software engineering. The ideal candidate has the ability to balance technical prowess with proactive customer service in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

ul.li: Advanced knowledge of iOS, OS X and WatchOS product lifecycles
Demonstrated decision making skills in an engineering environment
Ability to quickly establish and manage complex cross-functional relationships
Detail oriented with strong project management lifecycle skills
Experience with relational databases, such as FileMaker and MySQL
At least 2 years project management experience in an engineering environment

div.p:
As a Hardware Allocations EPM, you will be responsible for:
Managing complex business relationships and hardware demand for all SWE teams Utilizing advanced engineering knowledge to analyze, interpret and make deductions based on previous experience and business patterns Maintain accurate and detailed hardware allocation database and library of units to support unexpected demand Prioritizing hardware processing and allocations based on engineering justification to drive development schedules Effectively identify program level challenges and constraints through cross-functional relationships Partnering with factories and international teams to drive shipping and receiving of development hardware Lead strategic initiatives to increase team efficiency, process management and cost savings
